Muzi is a terminal-based music player daemon (MPD) client written in Zig. It offers a slick, Vim-like interface with fuzzy finding for efficient music library navigation and queue management.

BrowserOS is an open-source, privacy-focused browser built on a Chromium fork, designed to run AI agents natively within the browser. It offers a familiar Chrome-like interface and supports local AI models, making it a secure alternative to cloud-based AI browsing tools.

ğŸ“ ğ—”ğ—•ğ—¢ğ—¨ğ—§ ğ—§ğ—›ğ—œğ—¦ ğ—£ğ—¥ğ—¢ğ—ğ—˜ğ—–ğ—§

Converseen is a free, cross-platform batch image processor that allows users to convert, resize, rotate, and flip an unlimited number of images with a single click. It leverages ImageMagick to support over 100 image formats and can also convert PDF documents into image sets.

OSTT is an interactive, terminal-based tool for recording audio and transcribing it into text using various AI providers. It features real-time audio visualization, noise gating, and a browsable history of transcriptions, designed for performance and minimal dependencies on Linux and macOS.
